alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 22 at 10:06PM EST until January 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Otsego and Delaware counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with some sleet or freezing rain tonight before changing back to all snow in the predawn hours Monday. The snow could be heavy at times late tonight into Monday morning, with snowfall rates up to 1.5 inches per hour at times. Temperatures remain steady in the upper 20s to lower 30s, making for a heavy wet snowfall which could cause isolated power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
